New Records: This is the first time New Zealand have won a men's T20I match in Australia.
For the first time in 11 years, New Zealand managed to beat Australia in Australia across any format of the game.
89: Biggest margin of defeat in terms of runs for Australia in T20Is.
Devon Conway hit the highest score in T20Is against Australia in T20Is.
Tim Southee became the leading wicket-taker in men's T20Is.
This is the first time New Zealand managed to post 200 runs in a T20 World Cup match.
Key Match Events: New Zealand posted their first 200-run total in a T20 World Cup and they couldn't have asked for a better time to do it as the BlackCaps demolished the much-talked-about Australia bowling line-up at the Sydney Cricket Ground in the opening match of the Super 12 stage of the T20 World Cup.
Chasing 200, Australia never really looked in any control after losing David Warner early.
In just 17.1 overs, Australia were bundled out for 111.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Going forward, Australia need to focus on improving their Net Run Rate as the 89-run defeat hampered their NRR, sinking it to -4.450.
